metadata.Title: CVE-2022-48566 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in compare_digest in Lib/hmac.py in Python through 3.9.1. Constant-time-defeating optimisations were possible in the accumulator variable in hmac.compare_digest.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48566` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
libpython3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
libpython3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
libpython3.8-stdlib - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
libpython3.8-testsuite - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8 - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8-examples - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8-full - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8-minimal - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
python3.8-venv - 3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04
No subscription required

idle-python3.9 - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
libpython3.9 - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
libpython3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
libpython3.9-stdlib - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
libpython3.9-testsuite - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
python3.9 - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
python3.9-examples - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
python3.9-full - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
python3.9-minimal - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
python3.9-venv - 3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
python3.8 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.8.10-0ubuntu1~20.04').
python3.9 package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.5-3ubuntu0~20.04.1').
